overview:
Brian Hurley is the President and CEO of Purple Forge. He is an entrepreneurial leader with over 24 years of experience in building strong teams, innovative products and international businesses. Brian co-founded Purple Forge with John Craig. He previously founded Liquid Computing in 2003 and as it’s CEO raised over $44 million in venture financing, built a world-class team, delivered an award winning product to market and won international sales. He has built and led numerous successful business teams in Nortel, Bell-Northern Research and Microtel Pacific Research. Brian is the author of the best selling book “A Small Business Guide to Doing Big Business on the Internet”. He was the 2007 winner of the OCRI “Next Generation Executive” award. He is an active member of the local tech community and a past member of the OCRI Board of Directors. He is an alumnus of the Young Presidents Organization. Brian is a member of the GTEC SCOAP Honouree Selection Committee. He is an advisor to What Wins and other early stage companies. He is a founding member of the organizing committee for the 2009 re-launch of Lead to Win and is an active mentor to participant companies. Brian is a member of The Ottawa Network Board of Directors. Brian graduated from Carleton University with a Bachelor of Engineering.

More info available on LinkedIn - http://www.linkedin.com/in/brianrhurley
